channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: They oversee the flow of billions of dollars from Putin-connected Russians to companies involved in superyachts and villas. Now they’ve drawn the attention of a U.S. task force that is trying to disrupt the Russian war machine. https://t.co/KNKQ4fUuI1

Frightened students. Phone calls. Memorials and stuffed animals. From the University of Texas in 1966, to Columbine in 1999 and now Uvalde, the images of school shootings across America reveal hauntingly similar scenes. https://t.co/ofQrdQuwhG https://t.co/AwW2OJiPhP

Johnny Depp has been the face of Dior’s Sauvage men’s scent since 2015. The verdict is still out on whether Depp’s defamation case against Amber Heard hurt or helped sales, writes our fashion critic, Vanessa Friedman. https://t.co/UCsvuWstx9

The Biden administration said on Wednesday it would cut in half the amount it charges companies to build wind and solar projects on federal lands, a move designed to encourage development of renewable energy. https://t.co/9VwIC8h7Jc

In what was almost certain to be the emotional highlight of the #PlatinumJubilee, Queen Elizabeth II stepped out onto the balcony of Buckingham Palace.
Watch the celebrations live. https://t.co/v5whDCyP1Z https://t.co/MeY00gcqb0

Crowds erupted in applause as Prince George, Princess Charlotte, Prince Louis and other members of the British royal family rode down the Mall in carriages and on horseback.
Watch Queen Elizabeth II's #PlatinumJubilee celebrations live. https://t.co/cXViIsjfM6 https://t.co/tBSsrCo2ZG

Barack Obama paid tribute to Queen Elizabeth II in a video message in which he said they had formed their own “special relationship.”
Follow live updates on the #PlatinumJubilee celebrations. https://t.co/r2LBd7leXh https://t.co/Evum96FfL7

Prince George, Prince Louis and Princess Charlotte waved from the lead carriage during the Trooping the Color parade.
Queen Elizabeth II is not attending this part of the #PlatinumJubilee events, but younger royals are featuring prominently. Watch live. https://t.co/sYscQ5uVhr https://t.co/jEeluoH3KQ

Queen Elizabeth II's seven decades on the throne: in photos. 👑
Her long reign has made her a witness to cultural upheavals from the Beatles to Brexit, and political leaders from Winston Churchill to Boris Johnson. #PlatinumJubilee https://t.co/tIXJDxjXrm https://t.co/moYZNbyFPu
Breaking News: Doctors successfully transplanted a 3-D printed ear made of living human cells, a major milestone in bioengineering. https://t.co/CdeAdCdoUx

The Natalie Medical Building, where a gunman opened fire and killed four people, is part of the campus of the Saint Francis Hospital in Tulsa.
It is home to ambulatory and breast cancer surgery centers, the hospital’s website says. https://t.co/oLv04nJ5M6
The Ukrainian national soccer team defeated Scotland, 3-1, on Wednesday, bringing Ukraine within reach of its second World Cup appearance. https://t.co/Zt4c9G7CkA https://t.co/8h8ga5yjfz

Queen Elizabeth II is celebrating 70 years on the British throne — her Platinum Jubilee.
The festivities will begin with a military parade, a flyover, a gun salute and the royal family’s appearance on the balcony of Buckingham Palace. Follow along live. https://t.co/7V2qH8J3Kg

In Opinion
“I thought Vladimir Putin had invaded Ukraine. I was wrong. Putin had invaded Europe,” Thomas Friedman writes. “He shouldn’t have done that. This could be the biggest act of folly in a European war since Hitler invaded Russia in 1941.” https://t.co/mjvMBuMOeU

A 150-mile leisurely bike ride from Trieste, Italy, through Slovenia, to the ancient city of Pula, Croatia, brims with ancient traditions, sublime food and perched-village photo ops. https://t.co/jOeFDUHQX5 https://t.co/9sX6biHURi

For six weeks, the defamation case that the actor Johnny Depp filed against his ex-wife Amber Heard offered a rare instance of high-profile #MeToo charges and countercharges being hashed out in the public spotlight of a courtroom. https://t.co/ItJXGvuXZ0

Beto O’Rourke renewed his criticism of Gov. Greg Abbott over gun laws in Texas. “Not only did he not take action to save the lives of our kids,” O’Rourke said, “he took action to make it more certain that we would lose the lives of our kids.” https://t.co/RpkYJgQyAR
The Ukrainian national soccer team defeated Scotland, 3-1, on Wednesday, bringing Ukraine within reach of its second World Cup appearance. https://t.co/VNwVAQI0Wq

A woman who approached a bison at Yellowstone National Park was gored by the animal on Monday, according to park officials. Her condition was not released, and it was unclear whether she had survived. https://t.co/bHlV2l41zW
Breaking News: In its largest student loan forgiveness action ever, the U.S. Education Dept. will cancel $5.8 billion owed by students of Corinthian Colleges. https://t.co/S5MKUs6KIB
Breaking News: Multiple people were shot and some were killed at a medical building in Tulsa, Oklahoma, the police said. The gunman is also dead. https://t.co/FdK5vhHOFS

Breaking News: The man accused of the racist shooting at a Buffalo supermarket that left 10 Black residents dead was charged with a 25-count indictment, including murder charges as hate crimes and domestic terrorism. https://t.co/xGqoFpC7Jj

People who drank moderate amounts of coffee, 1.5 to 3.5 cups per day, were up to 30% less likely to die during a multiple year study period than those who didn’t drink coffee, new research found. https://t.co/zfs5ayvggf https://t.co/IIWD3S54gl
Breaking News: Sheryl Sandberg, the chief operating officer of Meta and the second in command to Mark Zuckerberg, said she was stepping down after 14 years. https://t.co/XlAL6zpeWe

Johnny Depp said the jury “gave me my life back.” Amber Heard said she’s “heartbroken.”
Get the latest following the verdict, in which a jury found that Depp was defamed by Heard but also that she'd been defamed by one of his lawyers. https://t.co/vumYhF2P3M https://t.co/3rOeNa2KY8

A jury found that Johnny Depp was defamed by Amber Heard when she described herself in a Washington Post essay as a “public figure representing domestic abuse,” but also found that she had been defamed by one of his lawyers. Read the latest: https://t.co/Ri0SE1vBiT https://t.co/2G4m0iPIYP

Breaking News: A jury found Johnny Depp was defamed by his ex-wife, Amber Heard, in a Washington Post essay in which she described herself as a “public figure representing domestic abuse.” Heard was defamed by one of Depp’s lawyers, the jury found. https://t.co/0hFmUqNVCF

After winning the Nobel Peace Prize, the journalist Dmitri Muratov said he thought the honor should have gone to a different Russian: the jailed opposition leader Aleksei Navalny. Now, he will auction it to help children who are refugees from Ukraine. https://t.co/JMgo2mtnNm https://t.co/FtdmydqjwK
Breaking News: The verdict in the Johnny Depp-Amber Heard trial is expected to be announced soon. Follow our live coverage. https://t.co/p4jBMSQyXF

The Russian journalist Dmitri Muratov — whose paper suspended publication in late March, saying Russia’s press laws made it impossible to truthfully cover the war in Ukraine — will be auctioning his Nobel Peace Prize medal to benefit Ukrainian refugees. https://t.co/VZCVkZxmz1

Elon Musk told SpaceX and Tesla employees that they were required to “spend a minimum of 40 hours in the office per week.” Those who did not do so would be fired, he wrote in a memo. https://t.co/eOwVV5UIGp https://t.co/pHzcnIDHm1

Sarah Palin lost her bid for a new trial in her libel case against The New York Times. A judge ruled that she had failed to produce “even a speck” of evidence to prove the newspaper had defamed her in a 2017 editorial. https://t.co/4Jx0iqVPHE
“The Wire” premiered 20 years ago, in June 2002. The creators David Simon and Ed Burns discussed why it has only become more relevant — and why it would never be made today. https://t.co/wTtbsQd3X4

The Russian military, demoralized after three months of war, is still facing morale and other problems, seven weeks after the Kremlin sent a new commander to oversee a refocused invasion, American officials say. https://t.co/WICddQYBem

In Opinion
"America’s goal is straightforward," President Biden writes in a guest essay. "We want to see a democratic, independent, sovereign and prosperous Ukraine with the means to deter and defend itself against further aggression." https://t.co/c2AM54y140
Rafael Nadal beat Novak Djokovic in four sets to reach the French Open semifinals in a thrilling addition to their long rivalry. https://t.co/qgwhrhBA8X

Sarah Palin lost her bid for a new trial in her libel case against The New York Times. A judge ruled that she had failed to produce “even a speck” of evidence to prove the newspaper had defamed her in a 2017 editorial. https://t.co/fCeia4GPZo

Adm. Linda L. Fagan will shatter one of the last glass ceilings in the military on Wednesday when she takes the oath as commandant of the Coast Guard and becomes the first female officer to lead a branch of the U.S. armed forces. https://t.co/eUh9ihXPcl

Despite widespread vaccination among older adults, the Omicron wave killed seniors in the U.S. at much higher rates per capita than Delta, preying on long delays since their last shots and showing the importance of boosters as campaigns nationwide wane. https://t.co/Qg1RjeczuI https://t.co/qq2z1QNZmP

Breaking News: Michael Sussmann​​, a lawyer with Democratic ties who flagged possible links between Donald Trump and Russia in 2016, was acquitted on a charge of lying to the FBI. https://t.co/n6Ajys4kVF

Russian mercenaries helped soldiers in the West African nation of Mali carry out a massacre, executing hundreds of civilians, witnesses and others said. Using satellite imagery, The New York Times identified the sites of at least two mass graves. https://t.co/KREIzPnRLg

Trump-era policies have left the U.S. far behind its peers in the race to combat climate change, according to a new report.
Only Denmark and Britain were on sustainable paths to reach net-zero by 2050, the study found. https://t.co/BXhXUPcx22

"We need to bring them home."
The wives and sisters of Ukrainian servicemen who were ordered to surrender to Russian forces at the Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol issued an urgent appeal to Ukrainian authorities and to the world to free their loved ones. https://t.co/l0dbs3nghu

The Ukrainian band that won Eurovision, Kalush Orchestra, put its trophy and a pink bucket hat worn by its lead singer up for auction to help supply drones to the Ukrainian army.
The items netted more than $1.2 million, the band’s spokeswoman said. https://t.co/Min2VQalVF
Canada would require most owners of “military-style assault weapons” to turn them over under a new proposed bill that is likely to pass. https://t.co/YAPnMFDTbr https://t.co/zXhymQL4Bi
Anger over two horrific mass shootings in Texas and New York has stirred a debate over whether releasing graphic images of gun violence would lead to better policy. https://t.co/ubQHAnhIEA
A Russian warplane crashed into a house in Ukraine. The family lived, almost miraculously. A few blocks away, things were different. https://t.co/o4Kd6Yqaur https://t.co/qzkXEFgbqk
Peter Navarro, a former aide to Donald Trump, said he received a grand jury subpoena in relation to the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol. https://t.co/uuWRBDeP9e

A century-old building under renovation in the Bronx has become one of the deadliest construction sites in New York City in almost two decades. But the consequences have been negligible and inspectors have exacted just $28,864 in fines. https://t.co/SYWLQ8ubzh
Canada would require most owners of “military-style assault weapons” to turn them over under a new proposed bill that is likely to pass. https://t.co/5ZHMRygSB0
